column4: I have 9.04 desktop setup, and I am trying to disable the screen saver from kicking in, and no matter what options I set, it comes back in 2 hours, any help appreciated
i recall having to disable dpms ages ago to get that effect.. but i dont recall the details.
is it the screensaver kicking in.. or the monitor powering off?
dpms hsa several modes.. it could be kicking in a low power mode.. befor it powers off.
try that setting and see I guess.  it wont hurt.
when doing 'xset -dpms' it returns saying "unable to open display"
when doing 'xset -dpms' it returns saying "unable to open display"
run it as the user that ran X.. not as root or any other user I guess
open a new terminal and try it?
, ok, ran it in a terminal and that ran fine.
how else were  You trying to run it? from the console? that wouldent work. :)
unless you set the DISPLAy variable first..
. so is that all I need to do, and just want and see?
unless you can think of some othet way to test it. :) i sure cant.
